maps.name: maps
maps.contactinfo: Customer Support Group Brocade Communications Systems, 120 Holger Way, San Jose, CA 95134 U.S.A Tel: +1-408-392-6061 Fax: +1-408-392-6656 Email: support@Brocade.COM WEB: www.brocade.com
maps.description: The MIB module is for Brocade's Monitoring and Alerting Policy Suite[MAPS] feature.

mapsTraps.name: mapsTraps
mapsTraps.description: The OID represents the MAPS Trap.

mapsConfig.name: mapsConfig
mapsConfig.description: The OID represents the MAPS Config params.

mapsConfigRuleName.name: mapsConfigRuleName
mapsConfigRuleName.description: It indicates the rule name which associates a condition with actions that need to be triggered when the specified condition is evaluated to true.

mapsConfigCondition.name: mapsConfigCondition
mapsConfigCondition.description: It indicates the condition defined in the rule. It includes the counter, time base and threshold value with the logical operation (eg: >, <, >= etc) that needs to be evaluated. Eg: (CRC/MIN > 10)

mapsConfigNumOfMS.name: mapsConfigNumOfMS
mapsConfigNumOfMS.description: It indicates the number of monitoring system entries in the notifications

mapsConfigMsName.name: mapsConfigMsName
mapsConfigMsName.description: This is monitoring system name like CRC, ITW, PS, FAN.

mapsConfigObjectGroupType.name: mapsConfigObjectGroupType
mapsConfigObjectGroupType.description: It indicates the object group type like circuit, PS, FAN.

mapsConfigObjectKeyType.name: mapsConfigObjectKeyType
mapsConfigObjectKeyType.description: It indicates the object key type. The main purpose of this object to help NMS applications to interpret the data easily. Eg: If the mapsConfigObjectGroupType is port then the key type is an integer and key value is the port number.

mapsConfigObjectKeyValue.name: mapsConfigObjectKeyValue
mapsConfigObjectKeyValue.description: It indicates the object key value. Incase of integer this field keeps as 1, 2, 3, 4, etc., and for string it keeps flowname1, flowname2, etc., Eg: if Group type is port, then the object key value is the port number.

mapsConfigValueType.name: mapsConfigValueType
mapsConfigValueType.description: It indicates the value type which could be integer, float or string. The main purpose of this object to help NMS applications to interpret the data easily.

mapsConfigCurrentValue.name: mapsConfigCurrentValue
mapsConfigCurrentValue.description: It indicates the actual value of the monitoring system.

mapsConfigTimeBase.name: mapsConfigTimeBase
mapsConfigTimeBase.description: The time period across which the change in a counter is to be monitored

mapsConfigSeverityLevel.name: mapsConfigSeverityLevel
mapsConfigSeverityLevel.description: It indicates the severity level of the condition triggered

mapsConfigMsList.name: mapsConfigMsList
mapsConfigMsList.description: It indicates the list of the monitoring systems. The format is <msname>,<value-type>,<current-value>,<time-base> ::<msName>,<value-type>,<current-value>,<time-base>::.

mapsConfigAction.name: mapsConfigAction
mapsConfigAction.description: It indicates the actions(bitmask value) that need to be triggered when the specified condition evaluated to be true. Action bitmask value mapping are none (0), raslog (1), snmp (2), port-fence (8), email (16), switchstatus-down (64), switchstatus-marginal (128), switchstatus-healthy (256), switchpolicy (512), sfp-marginal (1024) Ex: mapsConfigAction value 3 represents both raslog and snmp action

mapsTrapAM.name: mapsTrapAM
mapsTrapAM.description: Trap to be send for MAPS threshold events.
